title: High Crop Production Index
description: In 2022, Senegal achieved a Crop Production Index of 189.93, indicating a significant increase in agricultural productivity compared to the 2014-2016 baseline.

title: Strong Food Production Growth
description: Senegal's Food Production Index reached 177.49 in 2022, showcasing robust growth in food production since the 2014-2016 period.

title: Gender Parity in Primary Education
description: In 2021, Senegal achieved a Gender Parity Index of 1.164 in primary school enrollment, reflecting a higher enrollment rate for girls compared to boys.

title: Gender Parity in Primary and Secondary Education
description: The Gender Parity Index for primary and secondary school enrollment in Senegal was 1.175 in 2021, indicating a favorable balance towards female students.

title: Higher Female Enrollment in Primary Education
description: In 2018, 52.52% of primary education pupils in Senegal were female, highlighting a positive trend towards gender balance in education.

title: Limited Women's Decision-Making Participation
description: As of 2019, only 10.2% of women aged 15-49 in Senegal participated in key decision-making areas, indicating a need for improvement in gender equality.

title: Negative Aid Flow from Slovenia
description: In 2020, Senegal experienced a net negative bilateral aid flow of -$140,000 from Slovenia, reflecting a reduction in financial support.
